STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
September 12, 2023
Kathleen Schultz
Wellspring Lutheran Services- Lansing
5826 Executive Dr,
Lansing, MI, 48911-5303
RE: License#: CB330371021
Dear Ms. Schultz:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 9/11/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616)204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
FOM 801-03 Medical Passport
All medical information within the medical passport must be
current and updated at least quarterly to reflect the child's
current and complete health information.
An updated medical passport is provided to:
• Participating legal parents if the child is a temporary court
ward. Quarterly, while in out-of-home placement. At
reunification.
One of three foster care files did not have medical passports updated or signed by
parents quarterly.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• No technical assistance was required.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows. The agency had one
CAP during this review period. The CAP, approved 11/14/22, was a result of the
10/21/22 interim review. In that review, the agency had two violations regarding
employee performance evaluations and borrowed beds. During this review period
there were no repeat violations found.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed. The
CAA indicate the agency has successfully implemented their previous CAP. The
Chief Administrator reported the agency continues to struggle with staffing and
balancing caseloads when they are understaffed. However, they continue to
advertise, interview, hire and train.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Staff reported feeling supported by the agency
and able to discuss any concerns they have. The staff did not have any
suggestions for improvement, other than more time off or financial incentives for
high performing staff.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in an office building. There is sufficient office
space and common areas for staff to work and interact with families. There is
adequate locked storage to ensure confidential documents are secure.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
__ _________September 11, 2023________________________
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
September 12, 2023
_____________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
